cleaned.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1755

### Summary & Motivation

The [StableSurge](https://medium.com/balancer-protocol/balancers-stablesurge-hook-09d2eb20f219) hook has been deployed by the Balancer Labs team marking an exciting milestone for Balancer V3 as the first wave of hooks are hitting production. With these innovations come additional permissions related to the management of each hooks unique parameters. In the case of StableSurge the maxSurgeFeePercentage and surgeThresholdPercentage are key factors in determining how the hook will affect the pool performance and the liquidity providers. This proposal will act to grant the permissions to change both of these parameters to the Balancer Maxis on all currently deployed networks, Ethereum Mainnet, Gnosis, Arbitrum, and Base.

**Technical Specification:**

All deployments and action-ids can be verified in this StableSurgePoolFactory [pull request](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/pull/163/files#diff-17e7d1b01753c19be2eee514c14e09736db3af94d24025c7fd9876c73b6e7950).

**Ethereum**

On Mainnet the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Arbitrum**

On Arbitrum the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x261258d23af1013ceb3a0574a5f194e3d4d09a07c0b9014665519c3f1b37f792`, `0x5968f4b1f98171ccadc78df4f25cf8262b250f2f12a83c45b7311b4674d23e0a`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Base**

On Base the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0xe81edd4ccc5901443972e580b5d997ced38f33bd4f7e9bca8829dc5efcca6fed`, `0x4a7d099f7d634af69cf552b5b1c76ed8d44074051cbca5a59b842154288b96f1`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Gnosis**

On Gnosis the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-790] Grant Maxis Role for Balancer Contract Registry
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-790] Grant Maxis Role for Balancer Contract Registry
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1798

### Summary and Motivation 

Balancer has created a new registry contract called the Balancer Contract Registry in which we will add v3 contracts to.  This proposal seeks to grant the role for functions related to this contract to the Balancer maxis.  

### Technical Specification

The DAO Multisig on Ethereum, Base, and Gnosis will call the `Authorizer` ’s `grantRoles` function with the respective action id’s for the following functions to the omni multisig.


#### Mainnet
omni multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

`"addOrUpdateBalancerContractAlias(string,address)"`: `"0xc50be693f82453d6b7fbfabf52ae750e168eb530ce663aec7b2fe1c96cfdf381"`
        `"deprecateBalancerContract(address)"`: `"0xda5605d0e7c70ae825d1d2e45f0656490960542c725946cd5532909f723501b4"`
        `"deregisterBalancerContract(string)"`: `"0x534d9f0ca09366b50105b12a7492e9429c8621cf57c845195e7c6874fa413d03"`
        `"registerBalancerContract(uint8,string,address)"`: `"0xf539cbe9be426b500591a2dd63970d37952d95006d1039f35e731b4b52b33e73"`

#### Base
omni multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

`"addOrUpdateBalancerContractAlias(string,address)"`: `"0x0918fe18bf5dd7146d6ef70b2bc468e01847a23ebc248c46f0f3e860e760b95a"`
        `"deprecateBalancerContract(address)"`: `"0x4f36a3d4a5722964e73c1331cfbe74b0ce2717c92b0cb39e4e1bb402a34ce490"`
        `"deregisterBalancerContract(string)"`: `"0xff6339cb1834d4fd03de1defb693e9bdbaf87b32c6ef785e9c1e9306a13e0991"`
        `"registerBalancerContract(uint8,string,address)"`: `"0x6c32ca35628dd90c860faff8e24fa89e8ccb7546536eefc8365ceceb013efad1"`

#### Gnosis
omni multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`
`"addOrUpdateBalancerContractAlias(string,address)"`: `"0x96933475aa135d9d02d175e3f20f420fb65595ebeade476edf970dd5fddda874"`
        `"deprecateBalancerContract(address)"`: `"0xdb3b99d52cd97741d98d8cf58982c82a1c7caee958ed94e5fcf909ba57ef27bc"`
       ` "deregisterBalancerContract(string)"`: `"0xa2ccd901b5d57e951d23051ad0a49e4127722628b5f0318468fae768fd6e4a02"`
        `"registerBalancerContract(uint8,string,address)"`: `"0xd7b567352ab1dc8647c52f123cd411b5b0d47dbd5a4c5a65d799d675cc6604f2"`

### Arbitrum
omni multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`
`"addOrUpdateBalancerContractAlias(string,address)"` : `"0x86f7150372eac1ea58a41e472ce008974af1af41c17a9d2b75dd1eb608f7f1e1"`
`"deprecateBalancerContract(address)"` : `"0xcd03479a888f646243549839f3e3e0a8541e4fadd747050ce030b54ae2e3f3ea"`
` "deregisterBalancerContract(string)"` : `"0x35d64fe29e697ddb438d402a641010dac7cf88c9c2f8609d657125377d3554a0"`
`"registerBalancerContract(uint8,string,address)"` : `"0xd222e876fa09fc854125c959257507aa6ad490d65a8b94721974e7cc8953f739"`

All action id's can be found in this repo https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/tree/master/action-ids

Edits:
- add Arbitrum
- assign BIP IDs

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-741] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs
cleaned.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17

raw.title: [BIP-741] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
As per [BIP-734](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-734-balancer-v3-launch-and-protocol-enhancements/6168), Balancer V3 contracts have successfully been deployed to Ethereum and Gnosis! In order to both (1) call emergency functions (2) manage pool settings, it is proposed that the following existing multisigs are granted the following roles by the authorizer:

## Emergency DAO

- `VaultAdmin.pauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.pausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.unpausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.pauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.enableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.disableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.enableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQueryPermanently`
- `StablePoolFactory.disable`
- `WeightedPoolFactory.disable`

## Maxis

- `VaultAdmin.setStaticSwapFeePercentage`
- `StablePool.startAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `StablePool.stopAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFees`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFeesForToken`

# Payload

The required payload can be found [on our GitHub repo](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1535) and can be summarised as follows:

cleaned.title: [BIP-787] Grant Maxis Amplification Parameter Change Permissions for StableSurge Pools
cleaned.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17

raw.title: [BIP-787] Grant Maxis Amplification Parameter Change Permissions for StableSurge Pools
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1784

**Summary & Motivation**

In order for StableSurge to continue to gain adoption, the flexibility for the amplification factor to be changed allows for more or less slippage between the pairs in the pool. Due to the nature of stable surge, the end goal is to allow for more efficient swaps and charge higher fees when volatility occurs. The permission to manage this parameter will give the hook maximum opportunity for success.

Reference the deployments [repository](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/tree/bbe1ebb272b8b3085a7b91c33ff997ff72520327/action-ids) to confirm the corresponding action-ids. For example Base can be seen [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/bbe1ebb272b8b3085a7b91c33ff997ff72520327/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L514). 

Technical Specification:

The DAO Multisig on each network, Ethereum, Gnosis, Base, and Arbitrum will write the respective `Authorizer` calling `grantRoles` with the respective roles for `startAmplificationParameterUpdate` and `stopAmplificationParameterUpdate` for StableSurge factory created pools, the role will be granted to `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e` on all networks.. This will correspond to the following table.

|Network|DAO Multisig Address|Authorizer Address|startAmplificationParameterUpdate Role|stopAmplificationParameterUpdate Role|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|Ethereum|0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0x3050dfbb6294dc29c5cae13acb241fddea61d345d9b8c809f216c8259b013ff8|0x866d7d17a9b007d202e4da84f38a0bfbb310db8184a4f1d2e6de3c8e78ecd1e0|

raw.title: [BIP-276] Enable new L2 gauges
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### [PR with Payload](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/162)

### Motivation

Balancer contributors recently completed development on new non-ethereum ("L2") gauges which feature the ability to have cross chain reward boosts via Layer Zero. In order for these new gauges to function properly each child chain factory on L2 must be added to the pseudo minter on that network. If this is not done then BAL emissions cannot flow through the new gauges.


### Specification


### Arbitrum
#1
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x57f5e3be3930b0a9235265a5237eb44d5ec61fe36999757360b72280c4dcd991`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L593).

account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the pseudo minter `0xc3ccacE87f6d3A81724075ADcb5ddd85a8A1bB68` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x6817149cb753BF529565B4D023d7507eD2ff4Bc0`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/arbitrum.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x57f5e3be3930b0a9235265a5237eb44d5ec61fe36999757360b72280c4dcd991`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L593).

account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Polygon
#1
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x71b144ace6b2cd2762fedff00a9e45c9b7b742ee590f9d593c61e48b6c9ad790`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the pseudo minter `0x47B489bf5836f83ABD928C316F8e39bC0587B020` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x22625eEDd92c81a219A83e1dc48f88d54786B017`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/polygon.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x71b144ace6b2cd2762fedff00a9e45c9b7b742ee590f9d593c61e48b6c9ad790`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Gnosis
#1
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xff178bcb549aae01d4613b3ca6c16f1fa42e808cd1bddd210756b3878cfa9268`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the pseudo minter `0xA8920455934Da4D853faac1f94Fe7bEf72943eF1` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x83E443EF4f9963C77bd860f94500075556668cb8`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/gnosis.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xff178bcb549aae01d4613b3ca6c16f1fa42e808cd1bddd210756b3878cfa9268`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Optimism
#1
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x212ccfca4a02e0eff2a0a5029495a2697d4efa7a8e95cdbf30e2f38c40ca648f`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the pseudo minter `0x4fb47126Fa83A8734991E41B942Ac29A3266C968` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0xa523f47A933D5020b23629dDf689695AA94612Dc`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/optimism.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x212ccfca4a02e0eff2a0a5029495a2697d4efa7a8e95cdbf30e2f38c40ca648f`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: Proposal seeks to grant emergency DAO multisig wallets permissions to disable ECLP factories on multiple chains for security. Voting timeline shows unanimous and stable support for 'Yes'. Forum comments mostly neutral with positive endorsement. Similar past proposals with related permissions changes also passed with strong support and positive market responses.
key_arguments_for: Enables emergency DAO to act swiftly to disable factories in case of malfunction, enhancing protocol security.
Voting timeline metrics show stable and unanimous support throughout the voting period.
Forum sentiment includes positive support for granting these permissions for security reasons.
Similar past proposals with related permissions changes were successful and positively received.
key_arguments_against: No significant opposition or negative sentiment detected in forum or voting data.

evidence.quote: Forum comments include positive support for security permissions and neutral informational posts.
Unanimous and stable support for 'Yes, let's do it' with no votes for other options.
Similar permission and protocol fee processing proposals passed with strong support and positive market impacts.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Unanimous and stable voting support indicates strong consensus for the change.
- Forum sentiment is positive and neutral, supporting the emergency permissions as a security improvement.
- Similar past proposals with related permissions changes also passed successfully and benefited the protocol.
- Market impact is positive, reinforcing protocol health, although not used as a direct argument.
- Forum sentiment aligns with the recommended option, indicating community views are reflected in the decision.
